spanGrp.span: We know that in Soviet Union was basically Russian language.
biz bülierıh ki biz savetski ökmätıdi vasnavnom urus diliidi
All of us and also children speak Russian language.
bizım äp urus dillärdä ušahlarda vse äptä urus dilıni saerdıh
We also studied in Russian language.
ohirdıhtä onda vsyo mı prinyali rus urus dilındä
It’s a mother tongue for me and as a teacher I finished Russian school.
dlya menya eta radnoi yazık i kak prepadavatel akončil školu russkuyu
They were not letting us live in peace and we have retained Christianity and lost the language.
bizä xx ne davali pakoya eta khristianstvo astavili mı yazık pateriali
We were living in the Pontic Kingdom.
patom mı eta mı žili gde mı žili v pontiiskom tsar tsar tsarstvoda orda yaširdıh
The Pontic lands for twenty six centuries were located from Trabzon to Batumi.
dvadsat igirmi alti vek ordaidi s trapezundı do Batumi eta pontiiskoe bılo
Even the sea was named Pontic Sea after what it has changed into Black Sea.
daže more nazıvalo dierdılär pontiiskoe more patom pereiminavali v čyornoe
I can give an interview in Russian, but it’s ok.
eč xx š šeimdä yoh ama ya magu na russkom interviu i vsyo davat nu ničevo
They were not letting our people who came here live in peace.
bizım oralardan gälmä bizlärä dad vermädılär
People have died there but those who came were alive, that’s the situation in the Pontic Kingdom.
xx halh öldi oralarda boğierdılär edirdılär gäländä ğaldi ištem ambelä šindidä vot kakoe belya palaženia pontiski tsarstvoda
No, they don’t have an alphabet, because we speak this language.
yoh onnarın alfavitta yohtur nei šei xx xx patamu bu dildä biz söilierıh točna
When I am a Tamada I speak Russian in general.
nu gde vasnavnom vot ya kagda tamadalıh ederım na russkom ya vıstupayu vsyo ya vedu na russkom
